story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a beautiful kingdom called Shalom. In this peaceful and prosperous land, there lived a kind and wise queen named Queen Esther. She was beloved by all her subjects for her fairness and compassion.

One day, a terrible disaster struck the kingdom. A wicked sorcerer named Haman had cast a spell on the land, causing all the crops to fail and the rivers to run dry. The people of Shalom were struggling to survive, and they looked to their queen for guidance.

Queen Esther knew that she had to do something to save her kingdom. She called upon the finest scholars and rabbis in the land to help her find a way to break the sorcerer's spell.

After much study and prayer, the scholars and rabbis discovered that the only way to break the spell was to gather the finest ingredients from the farthest reaches of the kingdom and create a special potion.

Queen Esther summoned her most trusted advisors and set out on a journey to gather the ingredients. They traveled through deserts and forests, over mountains and rivers, facing many challenges and dangers along the way.

But Queen Esther was determined and brave, and she would not give up. Finally, after many long weeks, they gathered all the ingredients and returned to the palace.

The scholars and rabbis worked tirelessly to create the potion, and when it was ready, Queen Esther herself poured it into the river that flowed through the heart of the kingdom.

As soon as the potion touched the water, a miracle happened. The river began to flow again, and the crops started to grow. The people of Shalom rejoiced and sang praises to their wise and compassionate queen.

From that day on, the kingdom of Shalom flourished and prospered, and Queen Esther was remembered as a hero and a savior.

And so, my dear daughter, as you drift off to sleep, remember that just like Queen Esther, you too can be brave and determined. And may you always use your gifts and talents to help those in need. Goodnight, sweet princess.
